squidpony.squidmath

Class RNG

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidmath.RNG

  • public class RNG
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper class for working with random number generators in a more friendly way. Includes methods for getting values between two numbers and for getting random elements from a collection or array.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RNG()
      Default constructor uses Mersenne Twister, which is of high quality and fairly high speed.
      RNG(RandomnessSource random)
      Uses the provided source of randomness for all calculations.

      Returns a value between min (inclusive) and max (exclusive).
      int betweenWeighted(int min, int max, int samples)
      Returns the average of a number of randomly selected numbers from the provided range, with min being inclusive and max being exclusive.

      Returns a random elements from the provided queue.
      <T> T getRandomElement(T[] array)
      Returns a random element from the provided array and maintains object type.
      boolean nextBoolean() 
      double nextDouble()
      This returns a maximum of 0.9999999999999999 because that is the largest Double value that is less than 1.0
      float nextFloat()
      This returns a maximum of 0.99999994 because that is the largest Float value that is less than 1.0f
      double nextGaussian()

    • Constructor Detail

      • RNG

        public RNG()
        Default constructor uses Mersenne Twister, which is of high quality and fairly high speed.

      • RNG

        public RNG(RandomnessSource random)
        Uses the provided source of randomness for all calculations. This constructor should be used if setting the seed is needed as the provided source of randomness can be seeded as desired before passing it in.
        Parameters:
        random - the source of randomness

    • Method Detail

      • asRandom

        public java.util.Random asRandom()
        Returns:
        a Random instance that can be used for legacy compatability

      • between

        public double between(double min,
                      double max)
        Returns a value from a even distribution from min (inclusive) to max (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum bound on the return value (inclusive)
        max - the maximum bound on the return value (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the found value

      • between

        public int between(int min,
                   int max)
        Returns a value between min (inclusive) and max (exclusive). The inclusive and exclusive behavior is to match the behavior of the similar method that deals with floating point values.
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum bound on the return value (inclusive)
        max - the maximum bound on the return value (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the found value

      • betweenWeighted

        public int betweenWeighted(int min,
                           int max,
                           int samples)
        Returns the average of a number of randomly selected numbers from the provided range, with min being inclusive and max being exclusive. It will sample the number of times passed in as the third parameter. The inclusive and exclusive behavior is to match the behavior of the similar method that deals with floating point values. This can be used to weight RNG calls to the average between min and max.
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum bound on the return value (inclusive)
        max - the maximum bound on the return value (exclusive)
        samples - the number of samples to take
        Returns:
        the found value

      • getRandomElement

        public <T> T getRandomElement(T[] array)
        Returns a random element from the provided array and maintains object type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the returned object
        Parameters:
        array - the array to get an element from
        Returns:
        the randomly selected element

      • getRandomElement

        public <T> T getRandomElement(java.util.List<T> list)
        Returns a random element from the provided list. If the list is empty then null is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the returned object
        Parameters:
        list - the list to get an element from
        Returns:
        the randomly selected element

      • getRandomElement

        public <T> T getRandomElement(java.util.Queue<T> list)
        Returns a random elements from the provided queue. If the queue is empty then null is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the returned object
        Parameters:
        list - the list to get an element from
        Returns:
        the randomly selected element

      • nextGaussian

        public double nextGaussian()
        Returns:
        a value from the gaussian distribution

      • nextDouble

        public double nextDouble()
        This returns a maximum of 0.9999999999999999 because that is the largest Double value that is less than 1.0
        Returns:
        a value between 0 (inclusive) and 0.9999999999999999 (inclusive)

      • nextFloat

        public float nextFloat()
        This returns a maximum of 0.99999994 because that is the largest Float value that is less than 1.0f
        Returns:
        a value between 0 (inclusive) and 0.99999994 (inclusive)

      • nextBoolean

        public boolean nextBoolean()

      • nextLong

        public long nextLong()

      • nextInt

        public int nextInt(int bound)
        Returns a random integer below the given bound, or 0 if the bound is 0 or negative.
        Parameters:
        bound - the upper bound (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the found number

      • nextInt

        public int nextInt()
